ratings.comment: One of my favorite professors I've had at UF! Prof. Glotzer's lectures and in-class discussions are engaging and her assignments are open-ended and encourage students to be creative. She's also very kind and easy to talk to. While I'm only a History minor, I definitely plan on taking as many courses with her as I can!

Very interesting class at UF. It was very detailed and engaging. There is a good mix between teaching, reading, and discussing. The workload is light and more creative. Really informative about overlooked aspects of American history. Very worthwhile, I highly recommend. There are no slides to go off of, but she answers questions and speaks clearly.

Glotzer is great at simplifying complex concepts and communicating histories visually! She frequently incorporated maps and art into lectures, which we analyzed as a class. Very engaging and included diverse perspectives in content. She was thorough when answering students and never judgmental. Also, tests were open note. Definitely recommend her!

Prof Glotzer is a great professor and clearly loves what she teaches, as well as caring about how we do in the class. That being said, the criteria for the papers were hard to follow and would have been difficult for me to finish without any help. The lectures are very useful though and I went back to my notes often.

The notes acquired in lectures and discussions are influential to complete most homework assignments, thus grading is relatively, but fairly, hard. Not much outside work or hardship if you pay attention in lectures, however sometimes they can seem a bit long.

Prof Glotzer was so so knowledgeable and worked hard to make her lectures interesting and relatable. I found her to be very insightful. In my opinion the class was very easy, midterm wording was a bit tricky but graded generously. All other assignments were short and easy, clear guidelines with lots of room to work. Loved her, would reccomend!

Prof. Glotzer, teaching online, conveys the material clearly but without any change of page, emotion or humor.
Thus, the lectures are extremely dry.

Doctor Glotzer is a passionate professor and historian. Coming to her class was a pleasure and you could really tell she enjoyed history. This made her lectures enjoyable and well worth it. She is definitely approachable and willing to talk over any questions you may have. 10/10 recommend!

You read several hours of articles and journals each week and take a five question quiz on it. It's easy to get 2/5 or 3/5 if you only skim the readings. Two medium sized essays but no final which is nice.
